newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London stay at overnight level.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London stay at overnight level.

text.p: Hong Kong shares traded in London showed minimal activity, with little inspiration emanating from leading stock markets, traders said.

"It's been a quiet day owing to many European bourses closed for (national) holidays and a weaker London stock market today," said one trader. "There has been scant trading in HSBC and the shares have been trading near overnight levels. For many other stocks there has been no volume."
The Hang Seng London Reference Index was up 13.97 at 14,122.79. On Monday in Hong Kong, the Hang Seng closed up 46.45 to 14,108.82.
"Investors trading in London don't seem to want to commit themselves (to Hong Kong shares) ahead of the Federal Reserve meeting on interest rates," said another trader.
The Federal Reserve Open Market Committee (FOMC) will meet on Tuesday to discuss U.S. interest rate policy and fears that the authorities will raise rates have weakened the U.S. and UK stock markets.
